item.title: Explanation of Mr G. Stow's pictures: no. 2
item.summary: An explanation of No. 2 of Mr G.W. Stow’s collection of copies of Bushman Paintings was given, in the Katkop dialect by Díä!kwãin (L V.-22. 5739-5742). The painting features figures (numbered) and animals. Díä!kwãin describes some of the hunting methods of the |xam.
item.comments: 1) This story is found in Book V-22
item.author: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)

keyword.subkw: Dia!kwain's explanation of Stow's picture no. 2
